intro: Tridentea pachyrrhiza, commonly known as the thick-stemmed trident, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves. The plant has thick, fleshy stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Tridentea pachyrrhiza is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to coastal and mountainous regions.
